content.description:
Climb the beautiful, tall face of the Thriller Boulder staying more or less centered as you ascend.

A more difficult (and more exposed) variation can be done by climbing the left side of the slab that appears to be slightly separated from the rest of the face.  A classic and extremely aesthetic "boulder problem".
content.protection: the crux can be safely padded with one or two pads but do not fall from the top.
content.location: The Thriller Boulder is located about 200 yards up canyon from the No Substance Boulder.  From No Substance, follow a faint trail to the massive boulder easily seen from the road.

content.description: Wiggle your way through the hole at the start of No Substance.  Awkward and sandy, don't let the rating fool you on this one; you'll have to fight for this send!

On the backside of the Thriller boulder there are three problems that climb out a steep bulge feature.  The V4 is the rightmost problem of the three and begins with a SDS on a low rail.  Climb straight up and over.  Excellent rock quality and an interesting sequence make this lowball totally worthwhile.

The new Joe's Valley guidebook has names for all three of these problems but also renames the boulder entirely along with its namesake Thriller problem.  This had been known as Thriller V4 - Anyone know the real deal?
content.protection: Crashpad and spotter if you're sketchy on mantles.

content.description:
Wicked hard, nearly impossible if you don't have a long wingspan.  Start on a great sidepull/undercling crimp with your left hand and two measly dimples for your right, then fire up to the sharp slot above.  Top out on the apex of the boulder.

This is every bit of V11, and is a worldclass problem.

A sit down start bumps the grade up to V13.
content.location: It's 30ft from the road. You might need help if you can't find this one...

content.description: Start Matched in the jug, Right hand to sidepull, left hand to mono sloper pocket, right hand bump twice to jug, easy top out. Be careful with the monos, can hurt tendons

No Substance is the obvious left arete of the boulder with the same name.  Start on the big hole on the left (yes, you can fit through it.  Try going in feet first from the bottom!), and work your way up the arete to top out at the apex.  It's harder than it looks.
content.protection: Crashpad, and a spotter to keep you out of the tree if you fall from the top.
content.location: The left arete.  Can't miss it.

content.description: Sit start on awkward, bad low holds. Left to two finger pocket, right to gaston, right again to jug at lip. Not as terrible as some people say, I thought. Just a couple awkward-hard moves. Worth knocking out for kicks if you're at Pimpers.
